component.name: google-pubsub
component.title: Google Pubsub
component.description: Send and receive messages to/from Google Cloud Platform PubSub Service.
component.label: cloud,messaging

authenticate.label: common
authenticate.description: Use Credentials when interacting with PubSub service (no authentication is required when using emulator).

endpoint.label: common
endpoint.description: Endpoint to use with local Pub/Sub emulator.

serviceAccountKey.label: common
serviceAccountKey.description: The Service account key that can be used as credentials for the PubSub publisher/subscriber. It can be loaded by default from classpath, but you can prefix with classpath:, file:, or http: to load the resource from different systems.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

synchronousPullRetryableCodes.label: consumer
synchronousPullRetryableCodes.description: Comma-separated list of additional retryable error codes for synchronous pull. By default the PubSub client library retries ABORTED, UNAVAILABLE, UNKNOWN

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

publisherCacheSize.label: producer
publisherCacheSize.description: Maximum number of producers to cache. This could be increased if you have producers for lots of different topics.

publisherCacheTimeout.label: producer
publisherCacheTimeout.description: How many milliseconds should each producer stay alive in the cache.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

publisherTerminationTimeout.label: advanced
publisherTerminationTimeout.description: How many milliseconds should a producer be allowed to terminate.

projectId.label: common
projectId.description: The Google Cloud PubSub Project Id

destinationName.label: common
destinationName.description: The Destination Name. For the consumer this will be the subscription name, while for the producer this will be the topic name.

authenticate.label: common
authenticate.description: Use Credentials when interacting with PubSub service (no authentication is required when using emulator).

loggerId.description: Logger ID to use when a match to the parent route required

serviceAccountKey.label: common
serviceAccountKey.description: The Service account key that can be used as credentials for the PubSub publisher/subscriber. It can be loaded by default from classpath, but you can prefix with classpath:, file:, or http: to load the resource from different systems.

ackMode.label: consumer
ackMode.description: AUTO = exchange gets ack'ed/nack'ed on completion. NONE = downstream process has to ack/nack explicitly

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

concurrentConsumers.label: consumer
concurrentConsumers.description: The number of parallel streams consuming from the subscription

maxMessagesPerPoll.label: consumer
maxMessagesPerPoll.description: The max number of messages to receive from the server in a single API call

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

pubsubEndpoint.label: producer,advanced
pubsubEndpoint.description: Pub/Sub endpoint to use. Required when using message ordering, and ensures that messages are received in order even when multiple publishers are used

serializer.label: producer,advanced
serializer.description: A custom GooglePubsubSerializer to use for serializing message payloads in the producer
